Body:
Your friend Bianca has Geometry homework due next period, and she forgot all about it! Quickly write a program to solve
Pythagoras theorem before the homework is due.

Use the following theorem (you are given a and b, so solve for c):

<img/>
Input:
The first line will contain a single integer n (0 < n < 100) that indicates the number of data sets that follow. Each data
set will consist of two integers A and B (0 < A, B < 1000), separated by a space, denoting the values A and B in the equation
above.
Output:
Output the value of C (0 < C < 1000000) given the A and B values from the input, rounded to 2 decimal places, as
shown below.
